data.title: HTML entities
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Ultimate x64

Hello! If possible, it would be nice to add html entities. For example, if I type "&" and emmet shows suggestions for a choice.

Examples of entities:
- &copy (Copyright) - ©;
- &reg (Registered trademark) - ®.

![figure](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29632606/29719697-8d68fe48-89fa-11e7-9096-c2992497fdc9.jpg)

Complete list of HTML entities: [HTML Entity List](http://www.freeformatter.com/html-entities.html)

data.title: Snippets are only loaded when language is loaded
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: win7x64

You have CSS snippet, like this:
```
"border": {
  "prefix": "bd",
  "body": [
    "border: ${1:1px} solid #${2:000};$0"
  ],
  "description": "border"
}
```
And if you will try to type "bd" in the <style>bd</style> - it will not show you ur snippet in the list.
**Until you will visit the tab with .css file.**
So, you have to start VS Code and make sure, that .css file "is not chosen". And you will not see any of your custom snippets.

**The same bug with javascript snippets and .js files.
It's not about language problem, but about custom snippets trigger system.**

GIF:
![css custom snippets dont work from the start](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24613274/29719755-1dc77ff4-89c0-11e7-83d0-1e37ad7a5f7a.gif)

data.title: Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:5052).
data.body:
I use to be able to debug my Electron app's main process. Now after an update of VS Code, I get the error:

`Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:5052).`

My configuration has these settings:

```
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": "/usr/local/bin/electron",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/main.js",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"
```
I am able to run my Electron app by starting it with:

`npm start`

when I execute this command from a terminal in the project's root directory. I am using the latest version of VS Code (1.15.1)

data.title: Open a new terminal with on-the-fly shell
data.body:
Feature-request
Integrated-terminal

I wonder if I could open a new terminal with a non-default shell.

Mostly I'm working with PowerShell but, when I want to use Git Bash (or whatever different shell), I have to switch the default shell to Git, open a new terminal and then I have to switch the default back to PS.

It would be more comfortable to select the shell for the new terminal without any "default-shell" configuration. With a dropdown or with a different button, or maybe with a pop-up window.

data.title: Treat .pac as javascript file?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: None

.pac (Proxy auto config) file is a kind of javascript file which helps browser (or other app supports proxy auto configuration) find a proper proxy, so could you let vscode treat it as a javascript file?
pac wiki:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_auto-config

data.title: Global context keys
data.body:
Need a global context key support that is available in all locations (editor, sidebar)

From @jrieken [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30981#issuecomment-318328816)

>It doesn't work like that. The resourceLangId is defined only once but there multiple values associated to it. Think of a tree of context key values, only descendants see values from their containing context key service. So exposing a context key value "side-ways" from an editor to the sidebar doesn't make much sense. There is no definite answer here. Maybe a new context keys that only lives in the global/root context key service is needed, something like activeResource and that must be updated whenever the active editor or explorer updates...

data.title: VSCode hangs or freezes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:26:08.116Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-81-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11

---

Steps to Reproduce:

I cannot say exact pattern what to do to repeat freeze.
I am editing .js file which contains es2017 javascript code
Freezing happens after many hours of editing.
Freezing have happened know 3 times.
If I remember correctly freezing happens when I switch back from other program.
I was not doing anything special just editing file.
During freeze I cannot move cursor with cursor key.
If I click with mouse, the cursor is not moved to point where I click.
Only place which shows some reaction is that I can click menu and then menu dropdown appears.
If select action like Command Palette nothing happens.
This is so for all menu items.
One exception is Help About. It shows information of visual studio code version.
If I click x to close VSCode application, that works.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Not tested

data.title: [BUG] HTML attribute suggestions: Snippet session does not have end-position set
data.body: - VSCode Version: In Video - OS Version: Windows 8.1 and Linux Ubuntu 17.04 Gnome Steps to Reproduce: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vMqY3s4KiW0&ab_channel=GabrielMlocik Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**/No --- Popis: Vo verzii 1.11 funguje vetko korektne, v prpade potvrdenia Emmet alebo "suggestions" kurzor presunie do zvraznenej oblasti (cielov kurzor). Ale v novch verzich to u nefunguje, m novia verzia tm horie... naprklad potvrdenie emmet vytvor nov riadok namiesto potvrdenia. Rune je potreba presun kurzor do sprvnej pozcie. V prpade niektorch suggesti to rad nezmysli, ako napr. "". Prosm opravte to, a to funguje ako vo verzii 1.11, prpadne ete lepie to fungovalo v starej verzii kde aj po " --- [translate to EN from CZ/SK] : [by Google Translator] description: In version 1.11, everything works correctly, in the case of Emmet confirmation or "suggestions", the cursor moves to the highlighted area (target cursor). But in newer versions it does not work anymore, the newer version the worse ... for example emmet confirmation creates a new line instead of confirmation. You need to manually move the cursor to the correct position. For some suggestions, it does not seem like, "". Please fix it to work as in version 1.11, or even better it worked in an older version where even after "

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\GRE_Initialize]

data.title: Problem matcher failed to match problem if it's longer than integrated terminal width
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

Problem matcher:

```json
{
  "owner": "typescript",
  "applyTo": "allDocuments",
  "fileLocation": "absolute",
  "pattern": {
    "regexp": "^\\[biu-problem:typescript:([^;]*);([^;]*);([^;]*);([^;]*);(.*)\\]$",
    "severity": 1,
    "file": 2,
    "location": 3,
    "code": 4,
    "message": 5
  },
  "background": {
    "activeOnStart": false,
    "beginsPattern": "^\\[biu-problems:typescript:begin\\]$",
    "endsPattern": "^\\[biu-problems:typescript:end\\]$"
  }
}
```

Output that works:

```
[biu-problems:typescript:begin]
[biu-problem:typescript:error;c:\Projects\makeflow-web\src\server\scripts\generate-sample-data.ts;526,30;TS2345;Short enough]
[biu-problems:typescript:end]
```

Original output (that won't work):

```
[biu-problems:typescript:begin]
[biu-problem:typescript:error;c:\Projects\makeflow-web\src\server\scripts\generate-sample-data.ts;526,30;TS2345;Argument of type '({ uid: StringType<"task-uid">; timestamp: number; organization: StringType<"organization-id">; p...' is not assignable to parameter of type 'TaskDocumentCreationData'.]
[biu-problems:typescript:end]
```

Could it be some problem processing buffers and lines?

data.title: Starting Code results in "PowerShell language features are disabled due to an unsupported LanguageMode: ConstrainedLanguage" message
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
shell-launcher|Tyr|0.1.3



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start up Code
2. Open up the Terminal
3. Observe "PowerShell language features are disabled due to an unsupported LanguageMode: ConstrainedLanguage" error

If you look at the logs you see this:

```
[10:58:54] Language server starting...
powershell.exe started --
    pid: 11060
    exe: C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe
    args: C:\Users\jreilly\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.powershell-1.4.1\scripts\Start-EditorServices.ps1 -EditorServicesVersion '1.4.1' -HostName 'Visual Studio Code Host' -HostProfileId 'Microsoft.VSCode' -HostVersion '1.4.1' -AdditionalModules @('PowerShellEditorServices.VSCode') -BundledModulesPath 'C:\Users\jreilly\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.powershell-1.4.1\modules' -EnableConsoleRepl -LogLevel 'Normal' -LogPath 'C:\Users\jreilly\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.powershell-1.4.1\logs\1503655134-00c42217-4248-45b7-a606-46f526fd4a5a1503655127754\EditorServices.log' -SessionDetailsPath 'C:\Users\jreilly\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.powershell-1.4.1\sessions\PSES-VSCode-3976-523561' -FeatureFlags @()


PowerShell language features are disabled due to an unsupported LanguageMode: ConstrainedLanguage

powershell.exe terminated or terminal UI was closed
```

Interestingly, I have my terminal configured using `userSettings.json`:

```
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\sysnative\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0\\powershell.exe",
```

And I can open those terminals just fine.  Note that the erroring version is using a different exe: `C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe`.  

Can we configure the integrated to use the `sysnative` version as well?  Would that solve the problem?

data.title: ".vscode/settings.json" inside a workspace folder will render the editor inoperable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider  b9ac10234f86f145fdbcf066758934e0857d7592, 2017-08-25T05:24:57.523Z 
- OS Version: Windows 10
- Reproduces without extensions: Yes (note: extensions' .vscode/*.json doesn't seem to be affected)

Steps to reproduce:
- Place (an empty is enough) .vscode/settings.json file under a workspace folder,
- Open the workspace,
- Every file will now display "Place your folder settings here to overwrite those from the Workspace Settings." and merge some of the parsed .json contents with the editor, thus rendering the editor pretty much inoperable as it breaks e.g. syntax hilighting.

In my case, the .vscode/settings.json was a leftover file from an older version. Don't think it should break the VSCode anyway? A day older or so build was working just fine, so this is likely due to some very recent change. Tried with and without extensions.

data.title: Code lens from merge-conflict extension is active in output view
data.body:
While debugging I saw that there was a code lens provider active on the output views.
It turns out the merge conflict code lens which [registers for */**](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/aaa2c7eda4f3105093b6bf8ebbb187cc047dce4b/extensions/merge-conflict/src/codelensProvider.ts#L100)

The output views which can be big and be update very often (e.g. when some logging is turned on), resulting in constant requests for code lens.

For merge-conflict ideally it could only register on documents that are editable but there's currently no API to find that out (that said, the output view is a special case in that can modify, but through extension host API)

Best is probably to register for the `file` and `untitles` URI scheme only. 
In the future this might have to be reconsidered once modifying documents from document providers is possible and becomes common.

@alexandrudima FYI
